sense.name: measure or quantify something
sense.commentary: NP[object] SCALE [-transitive] PP[+quantity] NP[+agent] SCALE[+transitive] NP[+object]
sense.examples: Your luggage scales over fifty pounds, sir. He placed the white powder in the dish to scale it.

sense.name: climb up something
sense.examples: The enemy is scaling the outer walls of the castle! They had to turn back before they could scale the top of the mountain. The cat scaled a tree but was too scared to come back down.

sense.name: create a different-sized model of something
sense.commentary: NP[+agent] SCALE[+change] NP[+source] (NP[+target]) NP[+topic] SCALE[-transitive][+increase] ADVP includes VPC scale_down includes VPC scale_up
sense.examples: These blueprints are scaled wrong. I don't think this algorithm scales well. John scaled down the picture to half its original size. Are we ready to scale up production of the new chip design?

sense.name: remove skin from a fish
sense.examples: Scale the fish before you cut off the heads. We have been scaling these fish with a sharp knife.

sense.name: make smaller, reduce in size
sense.commentary: NP[+agent] SCALE_DOWN[+decrease] NP[+patient] NP[+agent] SCALE_BACK[+decrease] NP[+patient] Includes VPC scale_down, scale_back
sense.examples: They are scaling down their overseas investments. The senator's January proposal is being drastically scaled back. Under new management, Camera Bar has scaled back and is now only open for private function.
